src:
Bohumov uragan počistio Nirnberg
Premijerna pobeda kod kuće za beg iz opasne zone

04 Nov 2019

Sjajno prvo poluvreme Bohuma za beg iz opasne zone. Popularni klub iz rurske oblasti je vrednim trijumfom nad Nirnbergom od 3:1 najavio pohod ka sredini tabele koja mu je na samo tri boda, iako ne igra u skladu sa očekivanjima od početka sezone. Samo dve pobede na poslednjih deset utakmica u Cvajti imaju igrači Bohuma, ali je dolazak novog trenera Tomasa Rejsa definitivno pokrenuo stvari u gradu o kojem prelepo peva Herbert Grenemajer.
Večeras su sjajnom partijom u prvih 45 minuta savladali jednog od favorita za povratak u Bundesligu i najverovatnije potpisali otkaz treneru Damiru Kanadiju koji nema snage da izvuče popularni Der Klub iz rezultatkse krize.
Da se Nirnbergu crno piše bilo je jasno posle devet minuta kada je Danilo Soareš načeo gostujućeg rezervnog golmana Vilerta. Bohum je dominirao i napadao, a u finišu prvog poluvremena poptuno je prelomio utakmicu. Prvo je u 40. minutu štoper Lorenc povisio na 2:0 da bi u nadonadi prvog dela Manuel Vinchajmer, napadač na pozajmici iz HSV-a, postigao prvenac u plavom dresu u svom prvom nastupu kao starter u ovoj sezoni za velikih 3:0.
Uspeli su gosti da se trgnu u nastavku i smanje rezultat preko štopera Sorensena u 63. minutu, a možda bi utakmica dobila zanimljiviji tok da Nirnbergu nije poništen pogodak u 73. minutu pošto je VAR reklamirao ofsajd.
Bohum je posle toga sačuvao prednost i zabeležio prvu pobedu kod kuće u novoj sezoni posle koje se lakše diše. Zanimljivo, šansu je u redovima Bohuma na ovom meču dobio i srpski internacionalac Miloš Pantović. Ušao je u 82. minutu, a zaradio žuti karton u 88.     


Pogledajte najnoviju epizodu serije Ekipizza:

text:
Bochum hurricane cleared Nuremberg
Premiere victory at home to escape from the danger zone

04 Nov 2019

Great first half Bohum to escape from the danger zone. The popular club from the Ruhr area has announced a worthy triumph over Nuremberg 3-1 to hike towards the middle of the table, which is only three points away, although it does not play as expected from the beginning of the season. Bochum's players have only won two of their last ten games at Zweite, but the arrival of new coach Thomas Reis has definitely set things in motion in a town that is beautifully sung by Herbert Grenemaier.
Tonight they beat one of the favorites to return to the Bundesliga with a brilliant party in the first 45 minutes and most likely signed a dismissal for coach Damir Kanadi, who has no strength to pull the popular Der Club out of the crisis.
Nuremberg's black spelling was clear after nine minutes when Danilo Soares found the visiting backup goalie Willert. Bochum dominated and attacked, completely breaking the game in the first half. First, in the 40th minute, Lorenz's stopper increased to 2-0 so that in the second half, Manuel Vinchheimer, a HSV loan hitter, would make his blue jersey debut in his first appearance as a starter this season by a big 3-0.
The visitors managed to dive in below and reduce the score via Sorensen's stoppage in the 63rd minute, and perhaps the match would have received a more interesting flow if Nuremberg had not been canceled in the 73rd minute since VAR had advertised offside.
Bochum then retained the advantage and recorded his first home win in the new breathing season. Interestingly, Serbian international Milos Pantovic also got a chance in the Bohum ranks. He entered the 82nd minute, earning a yellow card in the 88th.
